intro: Masema dentatum, commonly known as the toothed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Masema dentatum plays a role in its ecosystem by providing food for certain bird species and contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
